items.title: Cleveland Browns to start Robert Griffin III vs. Bengals
items.author: Sessler, Marc
items.description: Robert Griffin III once again will be under center in an NFL game. RGIII will get the start this Sunday when the Cleveland Browns host the Cincinnati Bengals.
items.content: Robert Griffin III once again will be under center in an NFL game. RGIII will get the start this Sunday when the Cleveland Browns host the Cincinnati Bengals.

items.title: Tyrod Taylor: Questions about future don't affect me
items.author: Patra, Kevin
items.description: Tyrod Taylor has regressed this year in many ways from his standout first season with the Bills last year. Buffalo owns the No. 1 rushing attack but will need more out of Taylor for a playoff push.
items.content: Tyrod Taylor has regressed this year in many ways from his standout first season with the Bills last year. Buffalo owns the No. 1 rushing attack but will need more out of Taylor for a playoff push.

items.title: Osweiler: Texans face 'biggest game of our season'
items.author: Patra, Kevin
items.description: The Houston Texans travel to Indianapolis to face the Colts on Sunday with the division lead on the line. Brock Osweiler admitted the tilt is the biggest game of the season for Houston.
items.content: The Houston Texans travel to Indianapolis to face the Colts on Sunday with the division lead on the line. Brock Osweiler admitted the tilt is the biggest game of the season for Houston.

items.title: Adrian Peterson on '16 return: 'Something I envision'
items.author: Patra, Kevin
items.description: Adrian Peterson is getting closer to potentially returning from a knee injury, but the Minnesota Vikings running back wouldn't try to return this season if the team falls from playoff contention.
items.content: Adrian Peterson is getting closer to potentially returning from a knee injury, but the Minnesota Vikings running back wouldn't try to return this season if the team falls from playoff contention.

items.title: Matthew Stafford's control of Lions' 'O' key to revival
items.author: Patra, Kevin
items.description: Matthew Stafford's play under Jim Bob Cooter has spawned praise across the nation. The Lions offensive coordinator said empowering Stafford to take control of the offense has been the difference.
items.content: Matthew Stafford's play under Jim Bob Cooter has spawned praise across the nation. The Lions offensive coordinator said empowering Stafford to take control of the offense has been the difference.

items.title: Mariota's lethal deep ball key to Titans' breakthrough
items.author: Wesseling, Chris
items.description: As one of the hottest quarterbacks in the league, Marcus Mariota has the Titans in a three-way tie atop the AFC South. What accounts for Mariota's breakthrough? Chris Wesseling examines.
items.content: As one of the hottest quarterbacks in the league, Marcus Mariota has the Titans in a three-way tie atop the AFC South. What accounts for Mariota's breakthrough? Chris Wesseling examines.

items.title: Raiders’ defense holding up its end of the deal
items.author: Zac Jackson
items.description: The Raiders started the third quarter by forcing two turnovers, and they feel they should be closer than they are. Two turnovers only led to three points, and the Chiefs lead midway through the third quarter, 21-13. Sebastian Janikowski kicked a 33-yard field goal after a T.J. Carrie interception to start the second half. Raiders…

items.title: More big plays from Tyreek Hill spark Chiefs to lead
items.author: Zac Jackson
items.description: The Raiders showed some life late in the first half, and it’s a good thing they did. Thursday night’s game was on the verge of getting really ugly. The Chiefs dominated for much of the first half, and at halftime they hold a 21-10 lead. The Raiders trimmed the lead on a Latavius Murray touchdown…

items.title: Chiefs dominating, hold 14-3 lead
items.author: Zac Jackson
items.description: A 36-yard touchdown pass from Alex Smith to Tyreek Hill early in the second quarter gave the Chiefs a 7-3 lead on the Raiders. After a quick stop the Chiefs drove again with big passes to Travis Kelce and Chris Conley to set up a Charcandrick West touchdown run and make it 14-3. Smith is…

items.title: Raiders get early turnover, big defensive stand
items.author: Zac Jackson
items.description: It’s cold in Kansas City, and Thursday night’s Chiefs-Raiders game is off to a strange start. After a puzzling challenge by the Chiefs and then an automatic turnover review two plays later, the Raiders kept the ball — the original call was a catch and fumble by Amari Cooper — and then got a 44-yard…

items.title: Kelechi Osemele won’t play due to illness
items.author: Zac Jackson
items.description: Raiders guard Kelechi Osemele will not play Thursday night at Kansas City due to an illness. Osemele, who’s in his first year with the Raiders after signing as a free agent last March, has been a key player for one of the league’s best offensive lines. He had been listed on the injury report as…

items.title: Jordan Reed thinks he can deal with the pain, play Sunday
items.author: Zac Jackson
items.description: Redskins tight end Jordan Reed was again a limited practice participant Thursday, and after practice Reed told reporters he’s “optimistic” about his chances of playing Sunday at Philadelphia. Reed suffered an AC joint separation in his left shoulder at Dallas on Thanksgiving. Though he returned and finished the game, he didn’t play last week. Reed,…

items.title: Rams have no comment on report of dysfunction
items.author: Mike Florio
items.description: Thursday began with a bit of a bombshell from Albert Breer of TheMMQB.com regarding the extent of the dysfunction in the Rams organization. Recent comments from coach Jeff Fisher deemed critical of the team’s personnel function became the catalyst for anonymous quotes from an unnamed Rams source criticizing Fisher for an apparent effort to shift blame.…

items.title: Cam Newton: I’m not above the law
items.author: Darin Gantt
items.description: Cam Newton doesn’t mind taking the criticism, he’s used to that. But what the Panthers quarterback couldn’t handle were reports that his benching in Seattle Sunday night was related to something more nefarious than not wearing a tie on the team’s flight from San Jose to Seattle. “I violated the wardrobe [policy] and that’s it,” Newton…

items.title: Report: Patriots signing Griff Whalen
items.author: Josh Alper
items.description: Patriots wide receiver Danny Amendola is out with a high-ankle sprain and the hope is that he’ll be well enough to rejoin the team for the postseason, but his absence at present may have spurred a roster move on Thursday. Ian Rapoport of NFL Media reports that the team is signing wide receiver Griff Whalen…

items.title: Brandon Marshall: Pain pills mask my memory of 3-TD game
items.author: Michael David Smith
items.description: In 2014, Brandon Marshall had a three-touchdown game against the 49ers. As Marshall and the Jets prepare to play the 49ers on Sunday, he was asked what he remembers about that game. The answer? Not much. That’s because, Marshall says, he was using so many painkillers to play through an ankle injury that he was…

items.title: Eric Berry moves toward another payday
items.author: Mike Florio
items.description: Eric Berry’s big year is laying the foundation for another big payday. The Chiefs safety, to whom the team applied the franchise tag after his prior contract expired, didn’t sign a long-term deal before July 15. It means that the Chiefs soon will have to decide whether to apply the tag to Berry again, or…

items.title: Trevor Siemian practices, “progressing in the right way”
items.author: Josh Alper
items.description: The Broncos didn’t hold a full practice on Wednesday, opting for a walkthrough and estimated participation levels on the injury report instead. Quarterback Trevor Siemian, who missed last Sunday’s victory over the Jaguars with a foot injury, was estimated to be a limited participant in that non-existent practice and he was listed the same way…

items.title: Mathis, Geathers still absent from Colts’ practice
items.author: Zac Jackson
items.description: Colts defensive end Robert Mathis and safety Clayton Geathers missed practice again Thursday and could miss a second consecutive game Sunday. Geathers has a neck inury and Mathis has a bicep injury. Those two and starting cornerback Patrick Robinson missed last Monday’s rout of the Jets. Robinson has been a limited participant this week due…
items.content: Colts defensive end Robert Mathis and safety Clayton Geathers missed practice again Thursday and could miss a second consecutive game Sunday. Geathers has a neck inury and Mathis has a bicep injury. Those two and starting cornerback Patrick Robinson missed last Monday’s rout of the Jets. Robinson has been a limited participant this week due…

items.title: Raiders likely will focus on Derek Carr before Khalil Mack
items.author: Mike Florio
items.description: The Raiders emerged from the 2014 draft with great selections in round one and round two. By rule, both players (Khalil Mack and Derek Carr) are eligible for new contracts after the 2016 regular season ends. Per a source with knowledge of the situation, the Raiders are currently expected to focus on signing Carr before…

items.title: Mario Williams out of practice on Thursday
items.author: Josh Alper

items.title: Jets place Nick Mangold on injured reserve
items.author: Josh Alper
items.description: A report on Thursday morning had the Jets shutting center Nick Mangold down for the season after he got a second opinion on the ankle injury that’s kept him out of four games this season. The Jets confirmed that’s the case later in the day by placing Mangold on injured reserve. Wesley Johnson is expected…

items.title: Jadeveon Clowney practiced Thursday, considered day-to-day
items.author: Josh Alper
items.description: The Texans practiced without defensive end Jadeveon Clowney on Wednesday because of the elbow and wrist injuries that kept him from playing against the Packers last Sunday, but the news from Thursday’s practice was more positive. Clowney was able to get on the field with his teammates, a development that brightens his chances of playing…
